page.title: 08RAILWAY LINE STEVENAGE
page.content: The railway line near our school is the main route from London to Scotland The station was built near to the end of the High Street. As it was a rural area very few houses were knocked down but the brickyard in Symonds Green had to close. The Railway Arms was built to supply the workers and travellers on the new line.The railway helped to change Stevenage because families who wanted to live in the countryside but work in London built large houses in Julians Road and Hitchin Road just a short walk from the station. Some of these houses have been turned into small hotels now and the old station has been knocked down.Some small factories have been built on the land and a new station has been built in the New Town to make it easier for the several thousand people who travel to London every day to work.
